newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Bids recover, sales slow.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Bids recover, sales slow.

text.p: Cash bids for dark northern spring wheat recovered slightly on Wednesday, buoyed by a bounce in MGE futures, several cash merchants said.
Movement remained slow as farmers focused on assessing crop conditions following a heavy storm that ripped through Montana, North Dakota and Minnesota Tuesday and Wednesday.
"Anywhere from one to six or seven inches fell," one merchant said. "Anytime you get that much rain in a few hours, there's bound to be some damage to crops."
An eastern North Dakota dealer said fields were submerged and farmers were worried above severe crop damage.
"We got more than we needed," the dealer said. "I think there's been some serious damage to the crops."
Further west, the downpour helped spring wheat fields that had been in need of moisture. Winter wheat crops may not have fared as well.
"The rain did us good for the spring wheat," a Montana dealer said. "The winter wheat is looking kind of sick."
Price per bushel for 14-pct protein dark northern spring, durum and white wheats, in dollars per bushel:
Spring Chg Durum(m) Chg White Chg
Spring Chg HRW 13pct Chg White Chg
